definition: wooden figures buried with the dead
"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 9)
path screened by walls on both sides
the Yongjiang river 甬江[Yong3 jiang1] through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]/abbr. for Ningbo
variant of 桶[tong3], bucket/(classifier) cubic dry measure (5 pecks 五斗, approx half-liter)
figurines of warriors and horses buried with the dead/Terracotta Army (historic site)
lit. the first person to bury funerary dolls (idiom)/fig. the originator of an evil practice
a pottery figurine buried with the dead
pit with funerary figures/pit containing terracotta warriors

sentences.english: Even the nails on the suits and the hair and beards of the soldiers are carefully detailed.
sentences.chinese: 那鎧甲上最小甲釘甚至武士俑的頭髮鬍子都絲絲可見。

sentences.english: Warriors in array the excavations opening up to the world and sensation.
sentences.chinese: 俑陣經發掘對外開放後便轟動世界。

sentences.english: Lose my way, Im forced to fake.
sentences.chinese: 莪迷失勒方向，莪被逼俑叚面目視秂。

sentences.english: The special historical context makes the pottery figures collected by Lvshun Museum have un- usual characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 特殊的歷史背景使得旅順博物館所藏人俑極具特色。

sentences.english: There are thirty hand-finished figurines to collect in all.
sentences.chinese: 目前是30手完成俑收集所有。

sentences.english: Tomb figures in different regions have different characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 不同地區的俑，有不同的藝術風格和情趣。

sentences.english: The horse figure, Tang Dynasty. The horse body almost move at next second.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝的馬俑造型豐膩肥美，身形生動逼真動態十足。

sentences.english: The terracotta warriors were found in 1974 near Xi'an.
sentences.chinese: 戎馬俑1974年在西安相近被發現。

sentences.english: One of Mum's ceramic angel figurines fell from the knick-knack shelf.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽的一個天使陶瓷俑也從擺設架上掉了下來。
